name: glypy
comment: A library for representing and manipulating glycan structures and compositions. Also provides I/O interfaces with common formats and repositories of glycan structures.

name: glycopeptidepy
comment: An extension of `glypy` for modeling glycopeptides

name: brainpy
comment: A library to quickly generate isotopic patterns from elemental compositions.

name: ms_peak_picker
comment: A simple method adapted from Decon2LS for peak picking of mass spectra and cleaned up a little, with added signal processing filters

name: ms_deisotope
comment: Mass spectrum deisotoping and charge state deconvolution toolkit.

name: psims
comment: A declarative writer for mzML, mzMLb and mzIdentML formats.

name: glycresoft
comment: A LC-MS/MS search engine for glycans and glycopeptides.

name: glycopeptide_feature_learning
comment: A plugin for `glycresoft` that includes a multinomial glycopeptide fragment intensity model and a "simple" Bayesian fragmentation modeling framework.

name: mzspeclib-py
comment: An implementation of the HUPO-PSI [mzSpecLib](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/full/10.1021/acs.analchem.4c04091) format

name: chemical_elements
comment: Chemical compositions, formula parsing and isotopic pattern generation.

name: mzpeaks
comment: Representations of peaks and features for mass spectrometry data, and searchable collections there-of.

name: mzsignal
comment: Signal processing, peak picking, and feature extraction for mass spectrometry data.

name: mzdata
comment: Readers and writers for mass spectrometry data files and resources as well as spectrum and chromatogram structures.

name: mzdeisotope
comment: Deisotoping and charge state deconvolution for spectra and feature maps.

name: thermorawfilereader.rs
comment: FFI interface for reading Thermo RAW files from Rust via a self-hosted .NET runtime

name: mzdata-wasm
comment: A demo of how to use WASM to run Rust code for mass spectrometry data processing in the browser. [Demo](https://mobiusklein.github.io/mzdata-wasm/app/mzdata-viewer.html) is not mobile friendly

name: mass-fragment-index
comment: A generic framework for constructing in-memory or on-disk rapid search indices.
